result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn P Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Remaining balance to be paid along with costs at $50.00 per month commencing 8/15/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 6 days Huber for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Shawn P Shields in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weitzner makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $442.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 8/15/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 6 days in Huber
Sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
